titleStmt.title: The sea-mans compass or A dainty new ditty composed and pend the deeds of brave sea-men to praise and commend, 'twas made by a maid that to Gravesend did pass, now mark, and you quickly shall hear how it was. To the tune of, The tyrant hath stoln.
titleStmt.author: L. P. (Laurence Price), fl. 1625-1680?

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Laurence Price by Wing (2nd ed.)
Date of publication taken from Wing (2nd ed.)
Right half-sheet contains: The second part to the same tune.
Reproduction of original in: University of Glasgow. Library.
